snippet: In the last decade, the number of men who have left the work force entirely to raise children has more than doubled, according to recent United States census data.
abstract: United States census reports show the number of men who have left the work force entirely in order to raise their children has more than doubled in the last decade; a man's decision to stay home with the children is no longer seen as a failure, but a lifestyle choice--one that makes sense in an era in which women's surging salaries have thrown the old family hierarchy into flux.
lead_paragraph: In the last decade, the number of men who have left the work force entirely to raise children has more than doubled, according to recent United States census data.

headline.seo: Dads Are Taking Over as Full-Time Parents
headline.main: Just Wait Until Your Mother Gets Home
